INDICATOR_NAME: Population ages 15-64 (% of total population)
SOURCE_NOTE: Total population between the ages 15 to 64 as a percentage of the total population. Population is based on the de facto definition of population, which counts all residents regardless of legal status or citizenship.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: World Bank staff estimates based on age/sex distributions of United Nations Population Division's World Population Prospects: 2019 Revision.

INDICATOR_NAME: Population ages 0-14 (% of total population)
SOURCE_NOTE: Population between the ages 0 to 14 as a percentage of the total population. Population is based on the de facto definition of population.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: World Bank staff estimates based on age/sex distributions of United Nations Population Division's World Population Prospects: 2019 Revision.

INDICATOR_NAME: Unemployment, total (% of total labor force) (modeled ILO estimate)
SOURCE_NOTE: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in September 2019.

INDICATOR_NAME: Unemployment, male (% of male labor force) (modeled ILO estimate)
SOURCE_NOTE: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in September 2019.

INDICATOR_NAME: Unemployment, female (% of female labor force) (modeled ILO estimate)
SOURCE_NOTE: Unemployment refers to the share of the labor force that is without work but available for and seeking employment.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database. Data retrieved in September 2019.

INDICATOR_NAME: Labor force, total
SOURCE_NOTE: Labor force comprises people ages 15 and older who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period. It includes people who are currently employed and people who are unemployed but seeking work as well as first-time job-seekers. Not everyone who works is included, however. Unpaid workers, family workers, and students are often omitted, and some countries do not count members of the armed forces. Labor force size tends to vary during the year as seasonal workers enter and leave.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: Derived using data from International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database and World Bank population estimates. Labor data retrieved in September 2019.

INDICATOR_NAME: Labor force, female (% of total labor force)
SOURCE_NOTE: Female labor force as a percentage of the total show the extent to which women are active in the labor force. Labor force comprises people ages 15 and older who supply labor for the production of goods and services during a specified period.
SOURCE_ORGANIZATION: Derived using data from International Labour Organization, ILOSTAT database and World Bank population estimates. Labor data retrieved in September 2019.

INDICATOR_NAME: Government expenditure on education, total (% of GDP)
SOURCE_NOTE: General government expenditure on education (current, capital, and transfers) is expressed as a percentage of GDP. It includes expenditure funded by transfers from international sources to government. General government usually refers to local, regional and central governments.

INDICATOR_NAME: Government expenditure on education, total (% of government expenditure)
SOURCE_NOTE: General government expenditure on education (current, capital, and transfers) is expressed as a percentage of total general government expenditure on all sectors (including health, education, social services, etc.). It includes expenditure funded by transfers from international sources to government. General government usually refers to local, regional and central governments.

INDICATOR_NAME: Expenditure on tertiary education (% of government expenditure on education)
SOURCE_NOTE: Expenditure on tertiary education is expressed as a percentage of total general government expenditure on education. General government usually refers to local, regional and central governments.

INDICATOR_NAME: Government expenditure per student, tertiary (% of GDP per capita)
SOURCE_NOTE: Government expenditure per student is the average general government expenditure (current, capital, and transfers) per student in the given level of education, expressed as a percentage of GDP per capita.

INDICATOR_NAME: Expenditure on secondary education (% of government expenditure on education)
SOURCE_NOTE: Expenditure on secondary education is expressed as a percentage of total general government expenditure on education. General government usually refers to local, regional and central governments.

INDICATOR_NAME: Government expenditure per student, secondary (% of GDP per capita)
SOURCE_NOTE: Government expenditure per student is the average general government expenditure (current, capital, and transfers) per student in the given level of education, expressed as a percentage of GDP per capita.

INDICATOR_NAME: Expenditure on primary education (% of government expenditure on education)
SOURCE_NOTE: Expenditure on primary education is expressed as a percentage of total general government expenditure on education. General government usually refers to local, regional and central governments.

INDICATOR_NAME: Government expenditure per student, primary (% of GDP per capita)
SOURCE_NOTE: Government expenditure per student is the average general government expenditure (current, capital, and transfers) per student in the given level of education, expressed as a percentage of GDP per capita.

INDICATOR_NAME: Current education expenditure, total (% of total expenditure in public institutions)
SOURCE_NOTE: Current expenditure is expressed as a percentage of direct expenditure in public educational institutions (instructional and non-instructional) of the specified level of education. Financial aid to students and other transfers are excluded from direct expenditure. Current expenditure is consumed within the current year and would have to be renewed if needed in the following year. It includes staff compensation and current expenditure other than for staff compensation (ex. on teaching materials, ancillary services and administration).

INDICATOR_NAME: Current education expenditure, tertiary (% of total expenditure in tertiary public institutions)
SOURCE_NOTE: Current expenditure is expressed as a percentage of direct expenditure in public educational institutions (instructional and non-instructional) of the specified level of education. Financial aid to students and other transfers are excluded from direct expenditure. Current expenditure is consumed within the current year and would have to be renewed if needed in the following year. It includes staff compensation and current expenditure other than for staff compensation (ex. on teaching materials, ancillary services and administration).

INDICATOR_NAME: Current education expenditure, secondary (% of total expenditure in secondary public institutions)
SOURCE_NOTE: Current expenditure is expressed as a percentage of direct expenditure in public educational institutions (instructional and non-instructional) of the specified level of education. Financial aid to students and other transfers are excluded from direct expenditure. Current expenditure is consumed within the current year and would have to be renewed if needed in the following year. It includes staff compensation and current expenditure other than for staff compensation (ex. on teaching materials, ancillary services and administration).

INDICATOR_NAME: Current education expenditure, primary (% of total expenditure in primary public institutions)
SOURCE_NOTE: Current expenditure is expressed as a percentage of direct expenditure in public educational institutions (instructional and non-instructional) of the specified level of education. Financial aid to students and other transfers are excluded from direct expenditure. Current expenditure is consumed within the current year and would have to be renewed if needed in the following year. It includes staff compensation and current expenditure other than for staff compensation (ex. on teaching materials, ancillary services and administration).

INDICATOR_NAME: Tertiary education, academic staff (% female)
SOURCE_NOTE: Tertiary education, academic staff (% female) is the share of female academic staff in tertiary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, tertiary, male (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether or not to an advanced research qualification, normally requires, as a minimum condition of admission, the successful completion of education at the secondary level.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, tertiary, female (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether or not to an advanced research qualification, normally requires, as a minimum condition of admission, the successful completion of education at the secondary level.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, tertiary (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Tertiary education, whether or not to an advanced research qualification, normally requires, as a minimum condition of admission, the successful completion of education at the secondary level.

INDICATOR_NAME: Pupil-teacher ratio, tertiary
SOURCE_NOTE: Tertiary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in tertiary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed short-cycle tertiary, population 25+, total (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed short-cycle tertiary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed short-cycle tertiary, population 25+, male (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed short-cycle tertiary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed short-cycle tertiary, population 25+, female (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed short-cycle tertiary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least Master's or equivalent, population 25+, total (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed Master's or equivalent.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least Master's or equivalent, population 25+, male (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed Master's or equivalent.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least Master's or equivalent, population 25+, female (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed Master's or equivalent.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, Doctoral or equivalent, population 25+, total (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed Doctoral or equivalent.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, Doctoral or equivalent, population 25+, male (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed Doctoral or equivalent.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, Doctoral or equivalent, population 25+, female (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed Doctoral or equivalent.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least Bachelor's or equivalent, population 25+, total (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed Bachelor's or equivalent.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least Bachelor's or equivalent, population 25+, male (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed Bachelor's or equivalent.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least Bachelor's or equivalent, population 25+, female (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed Bachelor's or equivalent.

INDICATOR_NAME: Adolescents out of school (% of lower secondary school age)
SOURCE_NOTE: Adolescents out of school are the percentage of lower secondary school age adolescents who are not enrolled in school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Adolescents out of school, male (% of male lower secondary school age)
SOURCE_NOTE: Adolescents out of school are the percentage of lower secondary school age adolescents who are not enrolled in school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Adolescents out of school, female (% of female lower secondary school age)
SOURCE_NOTE: Adolescents out of school are the percentage of lower secondary school age adolescents who are not enrolled in school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Secondary education, teachers (% female)
SOURCE_NOTE: Female teachers as a percentage of total secondary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: Secondary education, teachers, female
SOURCE_NOTE: Secondary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: Secondary education, teachers
SOURCE_NOTE: Secondary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in secondary education (% of total teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in secondary education are the percentage of secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in upper secondary education (% of total teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in upper secondary education are the percentage of upper secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in upper secondary education, male (% of male teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in upper secondary education are the percentage of upper secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in upper secondary education, female (% of female teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in upper secondary education are the percentage of upper secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in secondary education, male (% of male teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in secondary education are the percentage of secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in lower secondary education (% of total teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in lower secondary education are the percentage of lower secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in lower secondary education, male (% of male teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in lower secondary education are the percentage of lower secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in lower secondary education, female (% of female teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in lower secondary education are the percentage of lower secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in secondary education, female (% of female teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in secondary education are the percentage of secondary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Progression to secondary school (%)
SOURCE_NOTE: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year (minus the number of repeaters from the last grade of primary education in the given year).

INDICATOR_NAME: Progression to secondary school, male (%)
SOURCE_NOTE: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year (minus the number of repeaters from the last grade of primary education in the given year).

INDICATOR_NAME: Progression to secondary school, female (%)
SOURCE_NOTE: Progression to secondary school refers to the number of new entrants to the first grade of secondary school in a given year as a percentage of the number of students enrolled in the final grade of primary school in the previous year (minus the number of repeaters from the last grade of primary education in the given year).

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, secondary, private (% of total secondary)
SOURCE_NOTE: Private enrollment refers to pupils or students enrolled in institutions that are not operated by a public authority but controlled and managed, whether for profit or not, by a private body such as a nongovernmental organization, religious body, special interest group, foundation or business enterprise.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, secondary, male (% net)
SOURCE_NOTE: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, secondary, female (% net)
SOURCE_NOTE: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, secondary (% net)
SOURCE_NOTE: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, secondary, male (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, secondary, female (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, secondary (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Secondary education completes the provision of basic education that began at the primary level, and aims at laying the foundations for lifelong learning and human development, by offering more subject- or skill-oriented instruction using more specialized teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: Secondary education, vocational pupils (% female)
SOURCE_NOTE: Secondary vocational pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in technical and vocational education programs, including teacher training.

INDICATOR_NAME: Secondary education, vocational pupils
SOURCE_NOTE: Secondary vocational pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in technical and vocational education programs, including teacher training.

INDICATOR_NAME: Pupil-teacher ratio, upper secondary
SOURCE_NOTE: Upper secondary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in upper secondary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Pupil-teacher ratio, secondary
SOURCE_NOTE: Secondary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in secondary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Pupil-teacher ratio, lower secondary
SOURCE_NOTE: Lower secondary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in lower secondary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Secondary education, general pupils (% female)
SOURCE_NOTE: Secondary general pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in general education programs, including teacher training.

INDICATOR_NAME: Secondary education, general pupils
SOURCE_NOTE: Secondary general pupils are the number of secondary students enrolled in general education programs, including teacher training.

INDICATOR_NAME: Secondary education, pupils (% female)
SOURCE_NOTE: Female pupils as a percentage of total pupils at secondary level includes enrollments in public and private schools.

INDICATOR_NAME: Secondary education, pupils
SOURCE_NOTE: Secondary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at secondary level in public and private schools.

INDICATOR_NAME: Secondary education, duration (years)
SOURCE_NOTE: Secondary duration refers to the number of grades (years) in secondary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed upper secondary, population 25+, total (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed upper secondary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed upper secondary, population 25+, male (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed upper secondary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed upper secondary, population 25+, female (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed upper secondary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed post-secondary, population 25+, total (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed post-secondary non-tertiary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed post-secondary, population 25+, male (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed post-secondary non-tertiary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed post-secondary, population 25+, female (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed post-secondary non-tertiary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed lower secondary, population 25+, total (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed lower secondary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed lower secondary, population 25+, male (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed lower secondary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed lower secondary, population 25+, female (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed lower secondary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Lower secondary completion rate, total (% of relevant age group)
SOURCE_NOTE: Lower secondary education completion rate is measured as the gross intake ratio to the last grade of lower secondary education (general and pre-vocational). It is calculated as the number of new entrants in the last grade of lower secondary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of lower secondary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Lower secondary completion rate, male (% of relevant age group)
SOURCE_NOTE: Lower secondary education completion rate is measured as the gross intake ratio to the last grade of lower secondary education (general and pre-vocational). It is calculated as the number of new entrants in the last grade of lower secondary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of lower secondary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Lower secondary completion rate, female (% of relevant age group)
SOURCE_NOTE: Lower secondary education completion rate is measured as the gross intake ratio to the last grade of lower secondary education (general and pre-vocational). It is calculated as the number of new entrants in the last grade of lower secondary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of lower secondary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Lower secondary school starting age (years)
SOURCE_NOTE: Lower secondary school starting age is the age at which students would enter lower secondary education, assuming they had started at the official entrance age for the lowest level of education, had studied full-time throughout and had progressed through the system without repeating or skipping a grade.

INDICATOR_NAME: Children out of school (% of primary school age)
SOURCE_NOTE: Children out of school are the percentage of primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school. Children in the official primary age group that are in preprimary education should be considered out of school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Children out of school, male (% of male primary school age)
SOURCE_NOTE: Children out of school are the percentage of primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school. Children in the official primary age group that are in preprimary education should be considered out of school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Children out of school, primary, male
SOURCE_NOTE: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Children out of school, female (% of female primary school age)
SOURCE_NOTE: Children out of school are the percentage of primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school. Children in the official primary age group that are in preprimary education should be considered out of school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Children out of school, primary, female
SOURCE_NOTE: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Children out of school, primary
SOURCE_NOTE: Children out of school are the number of primary-school-age children not enrolled in primary or secondary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Adjusted net enrollment rate, primary, male (% of primary school age children)
SOURCE_NOTE: Adjusted net enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.

INDICATOR_NAME: Adjusted net enrollment rate, primary, female (% of primary school age children)
SOURCE_NOTE: Adjusted net enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.

INDICATOR_NAME: Adjusted net enrollment rate, primary (% of primary school age children)
SOURCE_NOTE: Adjusted net enrollment is the number of pupils of the school-age group for primary education, enrolled either in primary or secondary education, expressed as a percentage of the total population in that age group.

INDICATOR_NAME: Primary education, teachers (% female)
SOURCE_NOTE: Female teachers as a percentage of total primary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: Primary education, teachers
SOURCE_NOTE: Primary education teachers includes full-time and part-time teachers.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in primary education (% of total teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in primary education, male (% of male teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in primary education, female (% of female teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in primary education are the percentage of primary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Repeaters, primary, total (% of total enrollment)
SOURCE_NOTE: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Repeaters, primary, male (% of male enrollment)
SOURCE_NOTE: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Repeaters, primary, female (% of female enrollment)
SOURCE_NOTE: Repeaters in primary school are the number of students enrolled in the same grade as in the previous year, as a percentage of all students enrolled in primary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Persistence to last grade of primary, total (% of cohort)
SOURCE_NOTE: Persistence to last grade of primary is the percentage of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach the last grade of primary education. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.

INDICATOR_NAME: Persistence to last grade of primary, male (% of cohort)
SOURCE_NOTE: Persistence to last grade of primary is the percentage of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach the last grade of primary education. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.

INDICATOR_NAME: Persistence to last grade of primary, female (% of cohort)
SOURCE_NOTE: Persistence to last grade of primary is the percentage of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach the last grade of primary education. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.

INDICATOR_NAME: Persistence to grade 5, total (% of cohort)
SOURCE_NOTE: Persistence to grade 5 (percentage of cohort reaching grade 5) is the share of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach grade 5. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.

INDICATOR_NAME: Persistence to grade 5, male (% of cohort)
SOURCE_NOTE: Persistence to grade 5 (percentage of cohort reaching grade 5) is the share of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach grade 5. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.

INDICATOR_NAME: Persistence to grade 5, female (% of cohort)
SOURCE_NOTE: Persistence to grade 5 (percentage of cohort reaching grade 5) is the share of children enrolled in the first grade of primary school who eventually reach grade 5. The estimate is based on the reconstructed cohort method.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, primary, private (% of total primary)
SOURCE_NOTE: Private enrollment refers to pupils or students enrolled in institutions that are not operated by a public authority but controlled and managed, whether for profit or not, by a private body such as a nongovernmental organization, religious body, special interest group, foundation or business enterprise.

INDICATOR_NAME: Over-age students, primary (% of enrollment)
SOURCE_NOTE: Over-age students are the percentage of those enrolled who are older than the official school-age range for primary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Over-age students, primary, male (% of male enrollment)
SOURCE_NOTE: Over-age students are the percentage of those enrolled who are older than the official school-age range for primary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Over-age students, primary, female (% of female enrollment)
SOURCE_NOTE: Over-age students are the percentage of those enrolled who are older than the official school-age range for primary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Net intake rate in grade 1 (% of official school-age population)
SOURCE_NOTE: Net intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are of official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the corresponding age.

INDICATOR_NAME: Net intake rate in grade 1, male (% of official school-age population)
SOURCE_NOTE: Net intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are of official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the corresponding age.

INDICATOR_NAME: Net intake rate in grade 1, female (% of official school-age population)
SOURCE_NOTE: Net intake rate in grade 1 is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education who are of official primary school entrance age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the corresponding age.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, primary, male (% net)
SOURCE_NOTE: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, primary, female (% net)
SOURCE_NOTE: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, primary (% net)
SOURCE_NOTE: Net enrollment rate is the ratio of children of official school age who are enrolled in school to the population of the corresponding official school age. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.

INDICATOR_NAME: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education, total (% of relevant age group)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.

INDICATOR_NAME: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education, male (% of relevant age group)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.

INDICATOR_NAME: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education, female (% of relevant age group)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross intake ratio in first grade of primary education is the number of new entrants in the first grade of primary education regardless of age, expressed as a percentage of the population of the official primary entrance age.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, primary, male (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, primary, female (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, primary (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Primary education provides children with basic reading, writing, and mathematics skills along with an elementary understanding of such subjects as history, geography, natural science, social science, art, and music.

INDICATOR_NAME: Pupil-teacher ratio, primary
SOURCE_NOTE: Primary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in primary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Primary education, pupils (% female)
SOURCE_NOTE: Female pupils as a percentage of total pupils at primary level include enrollments in public and private schools.

INDICATOR_NAME: Primary education, pupils
SOURCE_NOTE: Primary education pupils is the total number of pupils enrolled at primary level in public and private schools.

INDICATOR_NAME: Primary education, duration (years)
SOURCE_NOTE: Primary duration refers to the number of grades (years) in primary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed primary, population 25+ years, total (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed primary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed primary, population 25+ years, male (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed primary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Educational attainment, at least completed primary, population 25+ years, female (%) (cumulative)
SOURCE_NOTE: The percentage of population ages 25 and over that attained or completed primary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Primary completion rate, total (% of relevant age group)
SOURCE_NOTE: Primary completion rate, or gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education, is the number of new entrants (enrollments minus repeaters) in the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of primary education. Data limitations preclude adjusting for students who drop out during the final year of primary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Primary completion rate, male (% of relevant age group)
SOURCE_NOTE: Primary completion rate, or gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education, is the number of new entrants (enrollments minus repeaters) in the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of primary education. Data limitations preclude adjusting for students who drop out during the final year of primary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Primary completion rate, female (% of relevant age group)
SOURCE_NOTE: Primary completion rate, or gross intake ratio to the last grade of primary education, is the number of new entrants (enrollments minus repeaters) in the last grade of primary education, regardless of age, divided by the population at the entrance age for the last grade of primary education. Data limitations preclude adjusting for students who drop out during the final year of primary education.

INDICATOR_NAME: Primary school starting age (years)
SOURCE_NOTE: Primary school starting age is the age at which students would enter primary education, assuming they had started at the official entrance age for the lowest level of education, had studied full-time throughout and had progressed through the system without repeating or skipping a grade.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in preprimary education (% of total teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in preprimary education are the percentage of preprimary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in preprimary education, male (% of male teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in preprimary education are the percentage of preprimary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: Trained teachers in preprimary education, female (% of female teachers)
SOURCE_NOTE: Trained teachers in preprimary education are the percentage of preprimary school teachers who have received the minimum organized teacher training (pre-service or in-service) required for teaching in a given country.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, preprimary, male (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Preprimary education refers to programs at the initial stage of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce very young children to a school-type environment and to provide a bridge between home and school.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, preprimary, female (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Preprimary education refers to programs at the initial stage of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce very young children to a school-type environment and to provide a bridge between home and school.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, preprimary (% gross)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gross enrollment ratio is the ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population of the age group that officially corresponds to the level of education shown. Preprimary education refers to programs at the initial stage of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce very young children to a school-type environment and to provide a bridge between home and school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Pupil-teacher ratio, preprimary
SOURCE_NOTE: Preprimary school pupil-teacher ratio is the average number of pupils per teacher in preprimary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Preprimary education, duration (years)
SOURCE_NOTE: Preprimary duration refers to the number of grades (years) in preprimary school.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, tertiary (gross), gender parity index (GPI)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gender parity index for gross enrollment ratio in tertiary education is the ratio of women to men enrolled at tertiary level in public and private schools.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, secondary (gross), gender parity index (GPI)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gender parity index for gross enrollment ratio in secondary education is the ratio of girls to boys enrolled at secondary level in public and private schools.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, primary and secondary (gross), gender parity index (GPI)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gender parity index for gross enrollment ratio in primary and secondary education is the ratio of girls to boys enrolled at primary and secondary levels in public and private schools.

INDICATOR_NAME: School enrollment, primary (gross), gender parity index (GPI)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gender parity index for gross enrollment ratio in primary education is the ratio of girls to boys enrolled at primary level in public and private schools.

INDICATOR_NAME: Compulsory education, duration (years)
SOURCE_NOTE: Duration of compulsory education is the number of years that children are legally obliged to attend school.

INDICATOR_NAME: Literacy rate, adult total (% of people ages 15 and above)
SOURCE_NOTE: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.

INDICATOR_NAME: Literacy rate, adult male (% of males ages 15 and above)
SOURCE_NOTE: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.

INDICATOR_NAME: Literacy rate, adult female (% of females ages 15 and above)
SOURCE_NOTE: Adult literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15 and above who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.

INDICATOR_NAME: Literacy rate, youth total (% of people ages 15-24)
SOURCE_NOTE: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.

INDICATOR_NAME: Literacy rate, youth male (% of males ages 15-24)
SOURCE_NOTE: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.

INDICATOR_NAME: Literacy rate, youth (ages 15-24), gender parity index (GPI)
SOURCE_NOTE: Gender parity index for youth literacy rate is the ratio of females to males ages 15-24 who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.

INDICATOR_NAME: Literacy rate, youth female (% of females ages 15-24)
SOURCE_NOTE: Youth literacy rate is the percentage of people ages 15-24 who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life.
